page.title: 06THE CHURCH IN DAIRSIE
page.content: Dairsie church was built in 1848.In 1928 St.Leonards in Dairsie and St.Marys nearby joined congregations under one minister. St.Marys was used in summer because most people lived in Dairsie and they had quite a long way to walk and they didn't want to go down in the winter, St.Leonards was much handier then. When it was decided that they would only use one church, and St.Leonards was chosen,the people had to work really hard to make it comfortable and waterproof. They took pews,pulpit and choir stalls from St.Marys so they had something from each chruch. The renovated church was used for services in December 1966. There is a house in Station Road called "St.Leonards" which used to be the manse. Dairsie manse is now the one belonging to St.Marys. I live in it as my dad is Rev.A. Strickland.
